intro: Miliusa malnadensis, commonly known as the Malnad miliusa, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of evergreen forests. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
